document.masterDocTitle: Diversity and distribution of fiddler crabs (Brachyura: Ocypodidae: Uca) from China, with new records from Hainan Island in the South China Sea

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Fujian : 2 3 ( 15.55 , 18.63 mm ) (MBMCAS 166307 ), Chiyu, Changle, Fuzhou, coll. Fan & Xu,
15 Apr. 1957
; 1 3 ( 28.55 mm ), 1 ovig. Ƥ ( 27.83 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13180 ), Fuqing, south of Fuzhou, Fujian, coll. S.-L. Yang,
14 Apr. 1978
; 1 3 ( 22.67 mm ) (MBMCAS 166263 ), Dongshan, Zhangzhou, Fujian, coll. H.-L. Chen,
Jun.–Jul. 1974
.
Hong Kong
: 1 3 ( 18.69 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13365 ), Tai Tam, coll. B. Chan,
27 Oct. 2008
; 3 3 ( 17–22.69 mm ), 5 ƤƤ ( 4 ovig.) ( 16.85–19.56 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13207 ), Starfish Bay, coll. B. Chan,
Jul. 2004
. Hainan : 1 3 ( 16.05 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13366 ), 1 Ƥ ( 5.98 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13384 ), Wenchang, coll. K. Wong et al. ,
2 Dec. 2008
. Guangxi : 2 3 ( 16.12 , 23.6 mm ) (MBMCAS 161684 ), Gaode, Beihai, coll. R. Ma,
2 May 1978
; 9 3 ( 12.19–19.36 mm , one damaged), 1 Ƥ (damaged) (NCHUZOOL 13367 ), Qinzhou, coll. H.-T. Shih & Y.-H. Wang,
10 May 2009
.

Remarks.
Uca borealis
is similar to
U. vocans
and
U. jocelynae Shih,
Naruse & Ng, 2010
, all of which are sometimes sympatric (Shih et al. 2010 ).
Uca borealis
and
U. vocans
were here collected at the same locality at Wenchang, in the south of eastern Hainan. The males of the three species are easily distinguished by the morphologies of the male major cheliped and G 1 (Shih et al. 2010 ). Females can be distinguished by the structures of the gonopores (
Crane 1975 : fig. 64
). Biogeographically,
U. borealis
occurs in mainland Japan , Taiwan (including Penghu), Southeast and South China (Fujian; Guangdong; Guangxi; northern Hainan), and northern Vietnam (
Table 1
).
